node.title: American Democracy: A Status Check
node.description: A year after the Jan. 6 insurrection, what have we learned?
node.content: ["Just how much trouble is American democracy in? When we look to 2024, it\u2019s easy to focus on the doomsday scenario: an election where legitimate results get thrown out. But our democracy has been eroding for years \u2014 and we\u2019ve never been an equal democracy for everyone in the first place.", "[You can listen to this episode of \u201cThe Argument\u201d on Apple, Spotify or Google or wherever you get your podcasts.]", "Host Jane Coaston discusses the state of the U.S. democracy and whether Jan. 6 was a turning point with Masha Gessen, a staff writer at The New Yorker, and Corey Robin, a political scientist at Brooklyn College.", "(A full transcript of the episode will be available midday on the Times website.)"]
